title._content: [Portrait of Gene Sedric, The Place, New York, N.Y., ca. July 1946] (LOC)

description._content: Gottlieb, William P., 1917-, photographer. [Portrait of Gene Sedric, The Place, New York, N.Y., ca. July 1946] 1 negative : b&w ; 3 1/4 x 4 1/4 in. Caption from Down Beat: Gene Sedric. Sedric, the little honey bear who backed up the great Fats Waller records with his exciting tenor, has his own unit at The Place with another ex-Wallerite, Slick Jones, at drums. Notes: Gottlieb Collection Assignment No. 290 Reference print available in Music Division, Library of Congress. Purchase William P. Gottlieb Forms part of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (Library of Congress). In: The Record Changer, v. 5, no. 6 (Aug. 46, 1946), p. 10. Subjects: Sedric, Gene, 1907-1963 Jazz musicians--1940-1950. Saxophonists--1940-1950. The Place Format: Portrait photographs--1940-1950. Film negatives--1940-1950. Rights Info: Mr. Gottlieb has dedicated these works to the public domain, but rights of privacy and publicity may apply. lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-copyrig... Repository: (negative) Library of Congress, Prints & Photographs Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print (reference print) Library of Congress, Music Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, loc.gov/rr/perform/ Part Of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (DLC) 99-401005 General information about the Gottlieb Collection is available at lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-home.html Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.music/gottlieb.07731 Call Number: LC-GLB13- 0773
